message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.RO 

This paper deals with the problem of generalizing single-view 3D reconstruction models to new classes with limited training data. This problem is closely related to computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) as it involves developing a new model architecture that can learn to refine a provided, category-specific prior. The paper also discusses the use of multiple views for improving the reconstruction, which is a topic in computer graphics (cs.GR). The approach taken by the authors involves reframing the problem of single-view 3D reconstruction as a few-shot learning problem, which is a topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the authors evaluate their model on a robotic manipulation task, which falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO).
